intro: Weingartia tiraquensis var. lepida, commonly known as the Tiraquén Cactus, is a rare and compact species native to northern Argentina. It features short, cylindrical stems that are typically green with a bluish tinge, adorned with white to pale yellow spines. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well-suited for rock gardens and arid environments due to its drought tolerance. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a sought-after specimen among cactus enthusiasts.
